name: Czechia
description: Czechia, also known as the Czech Republic, is a landlocked country in Central Europe, renowned for its rich history, stunning natural landscapes, and vibrant cultural heritage. From the majestic Bohemian Switzerland National Park to the rolling hills of Moravia, Czechia offers a diverse range of experiences for travelers and nature enthusiasts alike. Its capital, Prague, is a UNESCO World Heritage site, famed for its medieval architecture, charming streets, and lively atmosphere.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Czechia is a relatively small country, making it easy to explore its diverse regions.
quickFacts.detail: The country's area is primarily comprised of fertile plains and hilly regions, with the Bohemian Forest forming a significant natural boundary.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Czechia boasts a population of over 10 million people, creating a dynamic and culturally rich society.
quickFacts.detail: The population density is approximately 136 people per sq km.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Prague, the capital, is a historic city with a thriving arts and culture scene.
quickFacts.detail: Prague is one of the most visited cities in Europe, attracting millions of tourists annually.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The official currency of Czechia is the Czech Koruna.
quickFacts.detail: The exchange rate fluctuates, but generally, 1 EUR is approximately 22 CZK.

quickFacts.label: Languages
quickFacts.detail: German and Slovak are also spoken in certain regions.

climateData.title: Climate of Czechia
climateData.description: Czechia experiences a temperate continental climate, characterized by warm summers and cold winters. Rainfall is relatively evenly distributed throughout the year.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a gradual warming, with blossoming trees and wildflowers transforming the landscape.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is the warmest season, with long sunny days and pleasant temperatures, ideal for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings cooler temperatures and stunning foliage, creating picturesque landscapes.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is cold and snowy, with occasional freezing temperatures. It's a time for cozying up indoors and enjoying winter sports.

naturalWonders.name: Bohemian Switzerland National Park
naturalWonders.description: Bohemian Switzerland National Park is a stunning landscape of sandstone formations, deep gorges, and pristine forests, offering breathtaking views and unique hiking trails. It's a haven for wildlife and a testament to the power of nature.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park is characterized by the Pravčická brána, the largest natural sandstone arch in Europe. The Elbe River carves through the sandstone, creating dramatic cliffs and valleys.

naturalWonders.name: Moravian Karst
naturalWonders.description: The Moravian Karst is a vast cave system, one of the largest in Europe, featuring impressive stalactites, stalagmites, and underground rivers. It's a geological wonder and a fascinating destination for exploration.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The caves are formed by the dissolution of limestone rock over millions of years. The Punkva Caves are particularly famous for their underground river.

naturalWonders.name: Šumava National Park
naturalWonders.description: Šumava National Park is a vast, unspoiled wilderness in southern Bohemia and Moravia, characterized by dense forests, peat bogs, and glacial lakes. It's a paradise for hikers, nature lovers, and those seeking tranquility.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park is home to a diverse range of flora and fauna, including lynx, wolves, and brown bears. The Černé jezero (Black Lake) and Čertovo jezero (Devil's Lake) are two of the park's most iconic features.

biodiversityCategory.name: Forest Ecosystems
biodiversityCategory.description: Czechia boasts extensive forests, covering approximately 33% of the country's land area. These forests are home to a rich diversity of plant and animal life, playing a crucial role in the country's biodiversity.

statistics.details: Common species include beech, oak, spruce, and fir.
Forests support a wide variety of bird species, including woodpeckers, owls, and songbirds.

notableSpecies.name: European Lynx
notableSpecies.significance: A top predator in the forest ecosystem, playing a vital role in maintaining balance.

notableSpecies.name: Great Spotted Woodpecker
notableSpecies.significance: An important insectivore, contributing to forest health.

ecosystemData.title: Forest Ecosystems of Czechia
ecosystemData.overview: Czechia's forests are a vital component of the country's natural heritage, providing numerous ecological and economic benefits. They contribute to carbon sequestration, water regulation, and biodiversity conservation.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forest Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: The dominant ecosystem in Czechia, characterized by diverse tree species and a rich array of associated flora and fauna.

statistics.details: Approximately 33% of Czechia's land area is covered by forests.
Czechia is a significant producer of timber.

notableSpecies.name: European Roe Deer
notableSpecies.significance: A common herbivore in the forest ecosystem.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Czechia
activities.description: Czechia offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all skill levels, from leisurely hikes to challenging climbs and water sports.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the stunning landscapes of Czechia on foot, discovering hidden trails and breathtaking views.

activities.name: Bohemian Switzerland Trail
activities.description: A challenging multi-day hike through Bohemian Switzerland National Park.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, waterproof clothing, map, compass

activities.name: Moravian Karst Loop Trail
activities.description: A scenic loop trail around the Moravian Karst caves.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the numerous rivers and lakes of Czechia with a variety of water sports.

activities.name: Kayaking on the Vltava River
activities.description: Paddle down the scenic Vltava River, passing through picturesque towns and villages.

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, map, compass, first-aid kit
